ComicInfo.Notes: Tagged with comicbox 1.1.1 on 2024-03-13T21:10:39 [Issue ID 4000-43957] urn:comicvine:4000-43957
ComicInfo.Summary:
Starr copes with his latest physical disaster, Jesse and Tulip attempt to reconcile their relationship, and Cassidy struggles to live with the results of his recent stupidity. Plus, Jesse's search for God intensifies.
Tulip tries to figure out how to handle Cassidy's confession, and begins to suspect that his promise to Jesse might have an ulterior motive; Starr tries on hats.
__
Our issue begins with Cassidy coming to grips with the fact he's the "biggest wanker in the entire world". The scene cuts to Tulip in bed with Jesse, laying there thinking about Cass's confession and explaining to Jesse why she felt so betrayed when he left her in France.
Meanwhile
Herr Starr begins trying on wigs. but decides to switch to hats when he realizes all the wigs look awful. Finally he finds a fedora of sorts which not only looks good but covers up the nasty scar from Jesse slitting his head open.
Elsewhere.
Cass, Jesse, Tulip and Amy all meet for a drink. Jesse gets up to have a dance with Amy while Tulip and Cass talk about his recent confession. Later on, Tulip and Amy leave to a more feminine place while Cass and Jesse get into a bar-fight of sorts.
Amy leaves and tells Tulip to call her if she ever needs her.
The book ends with The Saint of Killers off in the desert with few words left on his lips...
"War it is"
